thread.title: Spurs release video showing what 'New White Hart Lane' will look like in stunning detail
thread.title_full: Spurs release video showing what 'New White Hart Lane' will look like in stunning detail

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Spurs release video showing what 'New White Hart Lane' will look like in stunning detail
text:
Sport Spurs release video showing what 'New White Hart Lane' will look like in stunning detail The north Londoners will move into their new 61,000 seater stadium at the start of the 2018/19 season Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now This is what Spurs' new stadium will be like Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Development may be costing Spurs Â£400million - but their new stadium looks to be progressing nicely. And if the video above is anything to go by, it will be worth every penny. 
Construction for the 'New White Hart Lane' began in July and it included a corner of the north Londoners' current stadium being demolished. 
It also meant that Spurs had to play this season's Champions League games at Wembley due to certain UEFA restrictions. 
But two seasons of hardship will surely be worth it when Spurs move into their new lavish 61,000 seater stadium. View of the ongoing construction work from the High Road (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur Football Club) Bowl image from White Hart Lane (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur Football Club) 
The video animation shows aerial footage of the stadium as the camera flies over the roof and inside. 
We also get to picture what day and night games will look like at the 'New White Hart Lane' with the stadium packed out. Aerial view looking south east across site (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur Football Club) View from Northumberland Park (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur Football Club) 
The new venue will also play host to NFL games, something the animation blesses us with by showing us a sell out game. poll loading Spurs fans! Excited about the new stadium? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
